remarks: Strong (or "total") induction principle over the naturals.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 16-May-2014.)
statement:
nnsinds.1 $e |- ( x = y -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
nnsinds.2 $e |- ( x = N -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
nnsinds.3 $e |- ( x e. NN -> ( A. y e. ( 1 ... ( x - 1 ) ) ps -> ph ) ) $.
nnsinds $p |- ( N e. NN -> ch ) $.
$d N x $.
$d ch x $.
$d ph y $.
$d ps x $.
$d x y $.
